news.title: Bengaluru development body conducts door-to-door survey to identify tax dodging owners
news.para: The Greater Bengaluru Authority is conducting a large-scale survey to find property owners avoiding taxes. Surveyors are visiting every property, collecting data via a mobile app. This information will be cross-checked with satellite images and tax records. The drive aims to boost property tax collection, which has seen a significant dip this year.

news.title: Ludhiana civic body seals six commercial buildings
news.para: Municipal Corporation Ludhiana sealed six commercial buildings for illegal construction and unpaid dues. The action followed directions from MC Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal. Meanwhile, Atam Nagar MLA Kulwant Sidhu intervened to stop the MC tehbazaari team from removing roadside vends on Model Town Road. Civic officials stated they would return to clear encroachments.

news.title: Land deals surge in Nagpur, revenue up ₹147 crore in nine months
news.para: Nagpur's property market surged over nine months, registering over 1.25 lakh land transactions and generating ₹1,568.60 crore in stamp duty revenue. This growth, fueled by infrastructure projects like New Nagpur and Metro expansion, saw urban transactions rise significantly while rural areas experienced higher property valuations despite a slight dip in transaction numbers.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh hikes development fees by over 50% for key cities
news.para: Uttar Pradesh housing development authorities have significantly increased development charges for construction activities across major cities. The revised rates, approved this month, aim to account for rising construction costs and inflation, with some areas seeing hikes of up to 90%. These increased fees will fund urban infrastructure development, boosting the authorities' annual income.

news.title: Homebuyers' maintenance societies, RWAs can't intervene in insolvency process of developer: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has ruled that homebuyers' societies cannot intervene in the insolvency proceedings of a developer company. The court stated that these associations are formed for maintenance and management of common facilities. They lack the legal standing to participate in such insolvency cases.

news.title: DDA's Karmayogi Awaas Yojana sells 60 per cent flats in first 24 hours
news.para: The DDA Karmayogi Awaas Yojana 2025 has seen a strong start. Sixty percent of the 684 flats offered were booked within the first 24 hours. This initiative is expected to generate Rs 450 crore. The scheme is open for government employees until March 31, 2026.

news.title: Delhi Police EOW books Suraksha Realty for funds 'diversion' on ED complaint
news.para: Delhi Police has filed a case against Suraksha Group for allegedly diverting over Rs 230 crore from Jaypee Infratech. These funds were meant for stalled homebuyers. The Enforcement Directorate shared evidence for this FIR. Suraksha Group recently took control of Jaypee Infratech after an NCLAT decision. The ED is investigating a large-scale fraud involving homebuyers' money.

news.title: China Vanke seeks 90-day grace period extension for yuan bonds worth $817 million
news.para: China Vanke is proactively seeking an extension of grace periods for bond repayments, proposing an additional 90 trading days to stave off a potential debt default. Bondholders are set to cast their votes on this crucial proposal shortly.

news.title: Nuvoco Vistas reports net profit of ₹49.37 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Nuvoco Vistas has turned profitable, reporting a net profit of ₹49.37 crore for the quarter ending December 2025. Total income grew to ₹2,704.03 crore. Cement sales volume increased by 7% year-on-year.

news.title: Godrej Properties reports booking value of ₹34,171 crore in 2025
news.para: Godrej Properties achieved a booking value of ₹34,171 crore in 2025, a 19% increase. Cash collections rose 28% to ₹18,979 crore. The company sold 16,428 units across 41 launches.  Current financial year bookings also saw a 25% jump.

news.title: BOOTES enters residential development
news.para: BOOTES is launching with a portfolio valued at over ₹6,300 crore. Initial projects are planned for Noida, Alwar, and Vrindavan. The company also intends to expand its real estate presence to several other Indian cities.

news.title: HC appoints nodal officers to review illegal structures across Goa
news.para: The High Court has appointed two nodal officers to analyze reports from municipalities and panchayats regarding illegal structures across Goa. The state also submitted an affidavit informing the court about a law allowing regularization of residential structures meeting specific criteria, excluding commercial properties.

news.title: Construction workers in Uttar Pradesh urged to get registered for availing government benefits
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government organized awareness and registration camps at three labour hubs to strengthen social security for construction workers. The initiative aims to ensure doorstep delivery of welfare benefits, including education, health protection, and financial assistance, for registered workers and their families.

news.title: Truva raises ₹78 crore in fresh capital
news.para: Resale homes platform Truva has secured $9 million in new funding. This capital will expand its presence in Mumbai and into new cities like Delhi NCR and Bengaluru. The funds will also bolster its technology and inventory operations.

news.title: Ludhiana civic body levels nine illegal buildings in Lohara area
news.para: Ludhiana Municipal Corporation demolished nine illegal structures in Lohara, including five under-construction shops and four residential buildings, following Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal's orders. This action is part of a zero-tolerance policy against unauthorized development, with officials now required to certify compliant jurisdictions. Residents are warned to obtain approved building plans to avoid demolition and legal action.

news.title: Government to take call on housing board project at Cuncolim: Goa CM
news.para: The Goa government has not yet decided on a housing board project at Panzorconi in Cuncolim. Local opposition leader Yuri Alemao raised concerns about the project's impact on the village's social fabric, sports grounds, heritage, and environment. Chief Minister Pramod Sawant assured that all stakeholders will be consulted before any decision is made.

news.title: Goa: Court quashes Unity Mall’s construction licence in Chimbel
news.para: A district court has quashed the construction licence for Goa Tourism Development Corporation's Unity Mall project in Chimbel. This decision follows a two-week protest by residents concerned about the project's impact on the ecologically vital Toyyar Lake. The court's ruling overturned previous orders that had compelled the local panchayat to issue the licence.

news.title: Kolkata: 10 New Town residential plots up for e-auction
news.para: The West Bengal government is boosting residential development in New Town by e-auctioning 10 large plots, totaling approximately 4.7 acres, on a freehold basis. These plots, ranging from 1,500 to 2,000 sq m, are located in Action Area II and will be auctioned next month. This initiative aims to further expand housing options within the planned township.

news.title: Mohali development body starts e-auction of 42 prime sites worth ₹5,460 crore
news.para: Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (Gmada) will auction 42 prime sites worth Rs 5,460 crore from January 14 to February 11. This online mega e-auction aims to rationalize property prices, ensure transparency, and attract investors for residential, commercial, and institutional development. The initiative is part of the state government's strategy for planned urban development and economic growth.

news.title: Lucknow civic body cracks down to get house tax dues
news.para: The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) conducted a citywide house tax recovery drive, sealing and attaching numerous residential and commercial properties across multiple zones. This enforcement action against defaulters, including a building on Naval Kishore Road and shops in Sai Market, aimed to boost revenue. The drive resulted in significant collections and a stern warning to those with pending dues.
